intro: Mentzelia conzattii, commonly known as the Conzatti's blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Mentzelia conzattii is part of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its ecological importance to local pollinators.
